body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Rust are you using (`rustc --version`)?

rustc 1.14.0-nightly (5665bdf3e 2016-11-02)

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using?

macOS 10.11.6

3. What did you do?
If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error.
A complete runnable program is good.

./bin/tikv-server

4. What did you expect to see?

run with default configuration or exit with error code.

5. What did you see instead?
exit with error code 1 and got a stack backtrace.
```
2016-11-10 21:09:54,312 mod.rs:400 - INFO  - Welcome to TiKV.
2016-11-10 21:09:54,313 mod.rs:401 - INFO  - Version:
2016-11-10 21:09:54,313 mod.rs:402 - INFO  - Git Commit Hash: 936abf05de577f93c13d2725cec869f6c98a8e07
2016-11-10 21:09:54,313 mod.rs:403 - INFO  - UTC Build Time:  2016-11-10 12:59:26
2016-11-10 21:09:54,313 tikv-server.rs:83 - INFO  - server.addr, use default Some("127.0.0.1:20160")
2016-11-10 21:09:54,313 tikv-server.rs:828 - INFO  - Start listening on 127.0.0.1:20160...
2016-11-10 21:09:54,313 tikv-server.rs:83 - INFO  - pd.endpoints, use default None
2016-11-10 21:09:54,316 panic_hook.rs:85 - ERROR - thread 'main' panicked 'please specify pd.endpoints' at "../src/libcore/option.rs:705"
stack backtrace:
   0:        0x10608278e - backtrace::backtrace::trace::h16372ee7bf1517e5
   1:        0x106082a7c - backtrace::capture::Backtrace::new::hcc43c50c4b11c693
   2:        0x10606f7d4 - tikv::util::panic_hook::set_exit_hook::{{closure}}::hb14d8cbcd2b90ee2
   3:        0x1063564c3 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h00b81bb3dcbd51f2
   4:        0x106356394 - std::panicking::begin_panic::ha6a0d553db9869ff
   5:        0x1063562b2 - std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt::h24d113aee3ee4081
   6:        0x106356217 - rust_begin_unwind
   7:        0x106382de0 - core::panicking::panic_fmt::he441b2ea2036b98a
   8:        0x106382e4d - core::option::expect_failed::h7136772e5b75d3f8
   9:        0x105f57587 - tikv_server::main::h000b13565d60ecd3
  10:        0x106357d8a - __rust_maybe_catch_panic
  11:        0x106356896 - std::rt::lang_start::h74b3afbdd8daef1c
```
Question:

Is a stack backtrace suitable here? Or just exit with last error log is enough.
title: logs/stderr: run tikv without arguments, it shows a stack backtrace.
